page.title: 20Abberley churches
page.content:
St Michael's is still used for some services but the main church for the village is the "new" one, St Mary's.

In the course of restoration work at St. Michael's in the 1980s, a set of silver mediaeval spoons waes found.

The rectory, next to St. Michael's has been sold as a private house so can no longer be used for church events.

In common with many other parishes, Abberley no longer has a dedicated rector and shares a ministry team with other villages in the benefice and is administered by the rural dean of Stourport, the Revd Louise Grace.
